docs.snippet: The Nets, an efficient low-post team, gave Miami’s defense trouble during four regular-season wins. But the Heat have had a different intensity in the postseason since LeBron James’s arrival....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Nets, an efficient low-post team, gave Miami’s defense trouble during four regular-season wins. But the Heat have had a different intensity in the postseason since LeBron James’s arrival.
docs.abstract: Off The Dribble blog; Brooklyn Nets are 4-0 against Miami Heat in 2014 regular season, but Heat has a history of mocking regular-season results in the playoffs.

headline.main: Nets’ Flexible Attack Baffles Heat, but Playoffs Pose a Stiffer Test
headline.print_headline: Stiffer Test Looms for Flexible Attack

docs.snippet: The Sioux Falls Skyforce of the N.B.A. Development League and the Miami Heat have forged one of the more unusual and innovative partnerships in professional sports....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Sioux Falls Skyforce of the N.B.A. Development League and the Miami Heat have forged one of the more unusual and innovative partnerships in professional sports.
docs.abstract: Miami Heat have forged one of the most unusual and innovative partnerships in professional sports with NBA Development League affiliate Sioux Falls Skyforce; Heat have allocated significant resources to the Skyforce in an attempt to replicate their philosophies on a D-League scale.

headline.main: South Beach Meets Sioux Falls in D-League

docs.snippet: Rodney Stuckey scored 29 points, and the Detroit Pistons ended a 10-game skid in Atlanta with a 102-95 victory over the Hawks....

docs.abstract: Detroit Pistons beat Atlanta Hawks, 102-95, ending a 10-game losing streak; Hawks hold two-game lead over New York Knicks for the final Eastern Conference playoff spot; other basketball news noted.

docs.snippet: Mason Plumlee’s block put an exclamation point on the Nets’ win, which gave them a 4-0 record against the Heat this season....

docs.abstract: Brooklyn Nets beat Miami Heat, 88-87, giving Nets 4-0 current-season record against Heat for season.

headline.main: Nets Sweep Heat as Plumlee Blocks James’s Dunk in Final Seconds

docs.snippet: With a majority of the sport’s student-athletes leaving campus with a degree, teams and rivalries cultivate relationships that are often lost in the one-and-done world of the men’s game....
docs.lead_paragraph: With a majority of the sport’s student-athletes leaving campus with a degree, teams and rivalries cultivate relationships that are often lost in the one-and-done world of the men’s game.
docs.abstract: Harvey Araton On College Basketball column notes that while women's NCAA tournament is more predictable than its men's counterpart, it also involves deeper bonds among teammates because women typically stay with same school for all four years; notes that fact makes for dynasties and rivalries that are absent from the one-and-done world of the men's game.

headline.main: In Women’s Game, It’s Not Just Basketball, It’s Family
headline.print_headline: In Women’s Game, It’s Not Just Basketball, It’s Family

docs.snippet: In the first N.C.A.A. basketball final between two unbeaten teams, Connecticut defeated Notre Dame and completed a men’s and women’s championship double....
docs.lead_paragraph: In the first N.C.A.A. basketball final between two unbeaten teams, Connecticut defeated Notre Dame and completed a men’s and women’s championship double.
docs.abstract: Connecticut women's basketball team defeats Notre Dame, 79-58, to secure their record ninth NCAA tournament title in first matchup between undefeated teams in women's title game; victory means that Connecticut women's team again shares national title with men, as it did in 2004, contributing to the university's dominant reputation.

docs.snippet: Campus celebrations are winding down after two nights of championship parties, yet the off-court excitement could be just beginning at the University of Connecticut....
